snippet: The judge in the case of Mansour J. Arbabsiar, who has been in custody since his arrest in September, said it was not fair to postpone proceedings.
abstract: Federal Judge John F Keenan sets an October trial date for Mansour J Arbabsiar, Iranian-American man charged in an alleged Iranian plot to assassinate Saudi Arabia's ambassador to the United States; rules that Arbabsiar, who has been in custody since September 2011, has a right to a quick trial, especially given the international scrutiny of the case.
lead_paragraph: The judge in the case of Mansour J. Arbabsiar, who has been in custody since his arrest in September, said it was not fair to postpone proceedings.

headline.seo: Judge Sets Trial for Iranian-American in Plot to Kill Saudi Ambassador
headline.main: Judge Sets Trial Date in Alleged Plot to Kill Saudi Official
headline.print_headline: Trial Date in Alleged Plot To Kill Saudi Official Is Set
